item.title: Is our society less homophobic than it was in the past?
item.author: Stuart Haylock,Christopher Schlumberger-Socha,
item.description: Yes – Stuart Haylock Hate crimes started getting reported when people realised that others would listen Although homosexuality was legalised in England in 1967, the views of the people in the UK hardly changed at all. Those who came out as gay, acted gay, or were even remotely ‘metrosexual’ were …
